result.execSummary:
The defendant Isaac Castro was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Use of a Dangerous Weapon], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.descr: House of Correction - Imposed and Stayed

supervisions.notes: Sign up for probation no later than 10/28/2022 by 5:00 pm.

miscConds.notes:
No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms. 
No contact with MJW1 and MJW2.

Submit a DNA sample by 11/1/2022 by 3:00 pm and pay the surcharge during probation.  Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment/tax intercept.
Court waives all non-mandatory costs due to inability to pay.
Pay all MANDATORY costs, fees and surcharges during probation. Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment/tax intercept.

timeConds.notes: Huber for work.  Good time to apply. Court approves of electronic monitoring.  Defendant to report 11/28/2022.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Isaac Castro

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Isaac Castro in court.  Attorney Joseph Thomas Domask in court for Isaac Castro.  Prosecuting attorney M Samir Siddique in court for the State of Wisconsin. 

AS TO COUNT 1; Defendant changes plea to GUILTY. Defendant examined as to plea, advised of Constitutional Rights and the maximum penalties. Defendant further advised that if not a US citizen, deportation is possible. Court found that the defendant knowingly, voluntarily and intelligently waived rights.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights form, Addendum, and Elements/Jury Instructions received and filed. Parties stipulate to the Criminal Complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's plea.  Court found defendant GUILTY and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record.  

Pursuant to negotiations and on the motion of the State, court order count 2 DISMISSED AND READ IN.

Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the State, defense and defendant.    

AS TO COUNT ONE; Defendant ordered to serve 7 months in the House of Correction, credit of 0 days time served, Huber Privileges for work. Court STAYED the sentence and placed the defendant on probation for 12 months with the following conditions:

- Sign up for probation no later than 10/28/2022 by 5:00 pm.
- Serve 45 days condition time with Huber for work.  Good time to apply. Court approves of electronic monitoring.  Defendant to report 11/28/2022.
- No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms. 
- Complete a firearm safety course.
- No contact with MJW1 and MJW2.
-   Court waives all non-mandatory costs due to inability to pay.
- Submit a DNA sample by 11/1/2022 by 3:00 pm and pay the surcharge during probation.  Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment/tax intercept

- Pay all MANDATORY costs, fees and surcharges during probation. Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment/tax intercept.
- Defendant advised of his right to appeal.

Defendant Isaac Castro in court.  Attorney Joseph Thomas Domask appeared by video for Isaac Castro.  Prosecuting attorney Sarah Dahdouh in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Case in court for Calendar Call. Defendant appears. Court vacates the stayed warrant. 
Case adjourned for projected plea/sentencing hearing, Branch 30.
Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for October 28, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Attorney Joseph Thomas Domask in court.  Sarah Dahdouh appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Attorney appeared by video means for .  Deputy Court Clerk: SD.
Status conference held.   Defendant failing to appear, Court ordered a bench warrant issued but stayed the issuance until the next court date.

Defendant appeared late by zoom and was given next court date.  Calendar call scheduled for August 24, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Isaac Castro in court with attorney Joseph Thomas Domask.  Erika Strebel appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case in court for status. Defense in receipt of discovery and offer and requests an adjournment. Case adjourned to Br 30.  Status conference scheduled for August 10, 2022 at 09:00 am.

Defendant Isaac Castro in court with attorney Joseph Thomas Domask.  Adam Joseph Best appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Isaac Castro appeared by video means with Attorney.  
Case in court for pretrial conference. Defense counsel has received discovery and no offer from the state.  Defense requests status date to determine case posture. Case adjourned to Branch 30.  Status conference scheduled for June 28, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Court ordered no possession or use of any dangerous weapons or firearms.
DEFENDANT WAS ORDERED BY THE COURT TO REPORT TO THE MILWAUKEE COUNTY JAIL (CJF) TO BE BOOKED AND RELEASED BY 5:00 P.M. ON (5/1/2022). IF THEY FAIL TO APPEAR A BENCH WARRANT WILL BE ISSUED FOR THEIR ARREST.

Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with Marilyn.W. and Marilyn J.W.
No Weapons Order, signed and filed.
Court advised defendant that failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant Isaac Castro in court.  Paul Leonard Tiffin appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant advised that this case is assigned to Judge Richards, Branch 30.
Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause. Defendant received a copy of the complaint and was advised of right to counsel and maximum penalties.  Court entered a plea of not guilty on behalf of the Defendant. Court reserves Defendant's right to file a substitution of judge pursuant to Sec. 971.20 right to challenge probable cause and to have complaint read until Defendant's next scheduled court appearance. Defendant IS Public Defender eligible. Defendant is ordered to provide the public defender's office with the next court date.  
The case is adjourned to Br. 30 for a Pretrial Conference.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for May 19, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Summons mailed.  Defendant ordered into room 221 Safety Building on 04/29/2022@01:00
